header: Get my passport application file number
description: Fill in the fields below to get your file number. Make sure your information matches your passport application form. We'll then email the file number to the email address on file.

error.valid: The email address must be valid.

error.required: The given name(s) of applicant is required.
The surname of applicant is required.

error.current: The applicant date of birth must be in the past.
error.invalid: The applicant date of birth must be valid in the following format: YYYY-MM-DD (Year-Month-Day).
error.required: The applicant date of birth is required.

email-esrf: Email my file number to me
email-sent-confirmation: An email has been sent if there was a match in our records with the file number (ESRF).

email-confirmation-msg.if-exists: If we can find the file with the information you gave us, we'll email you the file number. If you don't receive the confirmation message in your inbox, check your junk email folder.
email-confirmation-msg.please-contact: If you don't receive it, call us toll free at {{phoneNumber}}.

page-unauth.desc: Please accept the Privacy and Email terms as well as give your consent before getting your file number (ESRF)

help-message.email: Provide your full email address exactly as provided on the passport application form.
help-message.for-child-application: For child applications, use the child's given name(s) and surname and date of birth, exactly as provided on their proof of citizenship.

header-messages.matches: Make sure your information matches your proof of citizenship and supporting ID. Your proof of citizenship could be one of the following:

list.item-4: other documents, like a naturalization certificate
